comment._content: Here is an account of the world championship match from the Chicago Billiard Museum site: October 28 - 30, 1914 World Three Cushion Challenge Match Doyle’s Billiard Academy – 112-114 West 42 nd Street - New York City, NY Game: Three Cushion Points: 150 Field: 2 Format: 3 – 50 point games played over 3 days Purse: $250 a side and the Jordan W. Lambert Trophy Alfredo De Oro Champion 150 George W. Moore Challenger 92 *** Alfredo De Oro Retains Championship Date Player Score HR IN vs Player Score HR IN October 28 De Oro 50 13* 61 Moore 28 5 60 Wednesday October 29 50 4 73 29 5 72 Thursday October 30 50 6 62 35 6 63 Friday Total 150 92 Innings 196 195 BPI .7653 .4717 Referee: Frank Keogh Note: In the first block of the match, Alfredo De Oro established a New World Record in champion play by score a high run of 13 points. The previous record of 11 was set by De Oro in St> Louis in 1911. Player Profile Age Hometown Title Nickname Hand Alfredo De Oro 51 New York City, NY Champion The Cuban LH George W. Moore 45 New York City, NY Challenger RH charlesursitti.com/?page_id=182

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: His opponent, billiards great Alfredo "The Cuban" de Oro, is also in the Bain Collection, in a picture dated October, 1914:

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content:
swanq and artolog:

Thanks for the great information about Mr. Moore.  This photo does not have a date inscribed on it, even though it does fall near other photographs in the Bain collection dating from October 1914, as you no doubt surmised based on the info you provided.  We will add some more detail to the record when we update.
